entities.name: John Watson
entities.description: The narrator, a doctor who served in the British army during the Second Afghan War, injured at Maiwand, and now seeking lodging in London.

entities.name: Murray
entities.description: Watson's orderly who saved him from the Ghazis at Maiwand by bringing him to safety.

entities.name: Stamford
entities.description: A former dresser under Watson at Barts, now a friend who introduces him to Sherlock Holmes.

entities.name: Sherlock Holmes
entities.description: A fellow working at the chemical laboratory at the hospital, seeking someone to share rooms with.

entities.name: University of London
entities.description: The university where Watson earned his Doctor of Medicine degree in 1878.

entities.name: Netley
entities.description: The location where Watson underwent training for army surgeons.

entities.name: Fifth Northumberland Fusiliers
entities.description: The British army regiment Watson was initially attached to as Assistant Surgeon.

entities.name: India
entities.description: The country where Watson's regiment was stationed during the Second Afghan War.

entities.name: Bombay
entities.description: The Indian city where Watson landed after traveling from England.

entities.name: Candahar
entities.description: The city in Afghanistan where Watson found his regiment during the war.

entities.name: Berkshires
entities.description: The British army regiment Watson was attached to after being removed from his brigade, served at Maiwand.

entities.name: Maiwand
entities.description: The location of the fatal battle where Watson was injured by a Jezail bullet.

entities.name: Ghazis
entities.description: Enemy forces during the Second Afghan War who threatened Watson after his injury.

entities.name: Peshawar
entities.description: The location of the base hospital where Watson was treated after his injury.

entities.name: Portsmouth jetty
entities.description: The jetty in Portsmouth where Watson landed upon returning to England.

entities.name: London
entities.description: The city where Watson stays after returning from India, seeking lodging.

entities.name: Strand
entities.description: The street in London where Watson stayed at a private hotel.

entities.name: Criterion Bar
entities.description: The bar in London where Watson meets Stamford.

entities.name: Barts
entities.description: St. Bartholomew's Hospital, where Stamford worked as a dresser under Watson.

entities.name: Holborn
entities.description: The location where Watson and Stamford have lunch together.

entities.name: Chemical Laboratory
entities.description: The laboratory at the hospital where Sherlock Holmes works.
The year Watson obtained his medical degree from the University of London.

entities.name: Second Afghan War
entities.description: The war during which Watson served in the British army, leading to his injury.

relationships.description: Watson earned his Doctor of Medicine degree from the University of London in 1878.
Watson underwent the prescribed course for army surgeons at Netley.
Watson was attached to the Fifth Northumberland Fusiliers as Assistant Surgeon.
Watson's regiment was stationed in India during the Second Afghan War.
Watson served in the Second Afghan War, which led to his injury.
Watson landed at Bombay after traveling to India.
Watson reached Candahar safely and found his regiment.
Watson was attached to the Berkshires and served with them at Maiwand.
Watson was struck by a Jezail bullet at the battle of Maiwand.
Murray saved Watson from the Ghazis by bringing him to the British lines.
Watson was threatened by the murderous Ghazis after his injury.
Watson was treated at the base hospital in Peshawar after his injury.
Watson landed at Portsmouth jetty upon returning to England from India.
Watson stays in London after returning to England, seeking lodging.
Watson stayed at a private hotel in the Strand in London.
Watson meets Stamford at the Criterion Bar in London.
Watson meets Stamford, a former acquaintance, in London.
Stamford worked as a dresser at Barts under Watson.
Watson worked at Barts, where Stamford was his dresser.
Watson invites Stamford to lunch at the Holborn.
Stamford knows Sherlock Holmes from the chemical laboratory.
Sherlock Holmes works at the chemical laboratory up at the hospital.
Watson is interested in sharing rooms with Sherlock Holmes after hearing about him from Stamford.

entities.name: Young Stamford
entities.description: A mutual acquaintance who discusses Sherlock Holmes with John Watson, warning him about Holmes' eccentricities and describing his scientific enthusiasms.

entities.name: Sherlock Holmes
entities.description: An eccentric individual with queer ideas, enthusiastic in science, skilled in anatomy and chemistry, with desultory studies and out-of-the-way knowledge, not a systematic medical student.

entities.name: John Watson
entities.description: A medical man seeking to share rooms and expenses, curious about Sherlock Holmes, and engaging in conversation with Young Stamford about him.

relationships.description: Young Stamford advises John Watson about Sherlock Holmes' eccentric nature.
Young Stamford describes Sherlock Holmes' studies and character to John Watson.
John Watson shows interest in Sherlock Holmes as a potential partner for sharing rooms.
